summary: This is an internal email chain from October 15, 2020, discussing discovery and disclosure issues related to a defendant named Adams in a case connected to the Epstein death investigation. The email contains notes from a call with 'PC chiefs' (likely prosecuting chiefs) regarding how to handle evidence from seized phones, unexecuted search warrants, witness statements, and materials from the Epstein investigation that may relate to Adams.

persons.name: Adams
persons.context: The defendant in the case, from whom two phones were seized. The discussion revolves around discovery obligations and potential Brady material related to him.

persons.name: Ted
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of agreeing to a 5-week advance production schedule for 3500 materials.

persons.name: Bekah
persons.context: Agreed with the approach on an unexecuted search warrant and suggested considering trying to execute the warrant again.

connections.description: Ted is involved in setting the discovery production schedule for materials related to defendant Adams.
Bekah is providing legal strategy advice regarding search warrants and discovery related to defendant Adams.

events.title: Call with PC Chiefs on Adams Disclosure
events.description: A call was held between prosecutors and 'PC chiefs' to discuss various discovery and disclosure questions related to the defendant Adams, including handling of seized phones, search warrants, and witness statements.

events.title: Seizure of Adams's Phones
events.description: Two phones were seized from the defendant Adams. The plan is to produce responsive materials in discovery, with full phone images to be produced at the 3500 deadline.

events.title: Epstein Death Investigation Interviews
events.description: As part of the Epstein death investigation, several inmates and BOP personnel were interviewed. The email discusses whether materials from these interviews that may mention Adams should be collected as potential future 3500 material.

keyFacts: The defendant Adams is connected to the broader Epstein case, as prosecutors are reviewing materials from the Epstein death investigation for any mentions of him.
Prosecutors seized two phones from Adams and are planning a specific timeline for producing the data (full images at the 3500 deadline).
An unexecuted search warrant was obtained relating to another woman Adams allegedly met at the MCC; prosecutors debated its discoverability.
Prosecutors discussed handling witness statements, potentially from an individual referred to as 'M', as Brady material, suggesting redacting names to 'witness-1', 'witness-2', etc.
The email references reviewing files related to 'Noel/Thomas' for witness statements about Adams, indicating other inmates or individuals of interest.
